greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-digit base-3 deletable primes.
comment: A prime p is a base-b deletable prime if when written in base b it has the property that removing some digit leaves either the empty string or another deletable prime. "Digit" means digit in base b.
Deleting a digit cannot leave any leading zeros in the new string. For example, deleting the 2 in 2003 to obtain 003 is not allowed.
mathematica: If[MemberQ[d, FromDigits[t, b]], AppendTo[d, p[[i]]]; ct++;
results.author: _Michael Kleber_, Feb 28 2003
ext: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Dec 14 2004
